pros: This employer is full of really good people who work very hard and are ethical in the way that they approach their jobs.
cons: It is difficult to detail any particular co s. There is not much to complain about here. I really liked this job.

pros: Friendly people. Students are smart snd diverse
cons: The people running the show are clueless. It felt like you were on a Worley gig. They'd direct you to do one thing then about-face in a new direction. One day about 20 people were let-go. Some had worked over 20 years. Many were women or poc.

pros: Relaxed dress code. Low-pressure. Good work/life balance. Values diversity.
cons: Below-market pay with no merit-based increases. Terrible health benefits (upwards of $800/month for a couple, regardless of your age or health status). Low morale after salaries were cut, with the administration saying they "can't say" when pay will be reinstated. Very little staff appreciation. Many directors have no managerial or organizational skills, and rely on their staff to do much of their work because they don't know how. No infrastructure for feedback. If you give constructive criticism, you will be branded as "negative" or "a squeaky wheel." Administration refuses to take responsibility for its role in the downward trajectory of the school.

job_title: Academic Tutor in San Diego, CA
pros: This school supports a very friendly culture and diverse environment.
cons: Parking downtown can be difficult if it isn't included as part of your employment, however for many it is included.
